remixlab.bias.core

Interface Grabber

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractScene, GrabberObject, InteractiveAvatarFrame, InteractiveEyeFrame, InteractiveFrame, Scene

    public interface Grabber
    Grabbers are means to attach a set of user-defined Action groups to application objects. Grabbers are attached to Agents through their API, and may be attached to more than just a single Agent.

    Each application object willing to subscribe a group of user defined actions should either implement the Grabber interface or extend from the GrabberObject class (which provides a default implementation of that interface), and override the following two methods: checkIfGrabsInput(BogusEvent), which defines the rules to set the application object as the agents Agent.inputGrabber(); and, performInteraction(BogusEvent), which defines how the application object should behave according to a given bogus event, which may hold a user-defined action.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean checkIfGrabsInput(BogusEvent event)
      Defines the rules to set the application object as an input grabber.
      boolean grabsInput(Agent agent)
      Check if this object is the Agent.inputGrabber().
      void performInteraction(BogusEvent event)
      Defines how the application object should behave according to a given BogusEvent, which may hold a user-defined action.

      • grabsInput

        boolean grabsInput(Agent agent)
        Check if this object is the Agent.inputGrabber(). Returns true if this object grabs the agent and false otherwise.
